data.name: Baconian Cipher
data.description:
# Baconian Cipher

In this kata, you have to encode a string, by replacing each of its letters which can only be -`a` and `b`. Each letter in the original string becomes a 5-letter word in the bacon's cipher. 

### Reference Table
```
Letter |  Code | Binary       Letter |  Code | Binary
A      | aaaaa | 00000        N      | abbaa | 01100
B      | aaaab | 00001        O      | abbab | 01101
C      | aaaba | 00010        P      | abbba | 01110
D      | aaabb | 00011        Q      | abbbb | 01111
E      | aabaa | 00100        R      | baaaa | 10000
F      | aabab | 00101        S      | baaab | 10001
G      | aabba | 00110        T      | baaba | 10010
H      | aabbb | 00111        U, V   | baabb | 10011
I, J   | abaaa | 01000        W      | babaa | 10100
K      | abaab | 01001        X      | babab | 10101
L      | ababa | 01010        Y      | babba | 10110
M      | ababb | 01011        Z      | babbb | 10111
```

Each letter in the string given, should be encoded, and be spaced. Each letter should be spaced, once encoded. In simple terms, each letter of the original string is one word in bacon's cipher. Therefore, the encoded string must be spaced, relative to each letter in the original string.

No numbers, special characters, or foreign, unknown characters should be included in the encoded string. They must be removed.

given strings can be uppercase, but all output should be returned as lowercase.

sentences will be tested too.

```python
baconian_cipher("encoded") => "aabaa abbaa aaaba abbab aaabb aabaa aaabb"
baconian_cipher("more strings") => "ababb abbab baaaa aabaa baaab baaba baaaa abaaa abbaa aabba baaab"
```

```python
baconian_cipher(";somethi+#ng") => "baaab abbab ababb aabaa baaba aabbb abaaa abbaa aabba"
baconian_cipher("123#$") => "" # empty, since none are actualy alphabets
```

```python
baconian_cipher("This is a sentence") => "baaba aabbb abaaa baaab abaaa baaab aaaaa baaab aabaa abbaa baaba aabaa abbaa aaaba aabaa"
```
Here's a link if you want to learn more:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacon%27s_cipher
